description: A new sustainable neighbourhood being created alongside 2km of south-facing Thames river frontage. A partnership with The Mayor of London and L&Q, 10,800 new homes will house up to 29,000 people.

factsheet.heading: Background
paragraphs: Overlooking London’s iconic River Thames, Barking Riverside is founded on an ambitious vision for what placemaking can achieve.
One of the most exciting new developments in Europe, the project will help transform a 443-acre former industrial site into a new London district that everyone can be proud of.

Co-created in close partnership with existing residents, the area is growing to become an exciting and vibrant neighbourhood of over 10,000 homes, commercial and leisure space, new schools and facilities, public open spaces and riverside walks. Connectivity will be enhanced by a new London Overground station and an Uber Boat by Thames Clippers pier.

The project is being delivered by master developers Barking Riverside Limited (BRL), a joint venture between housing association L&Q and the Mayor of London. BRL are partnering with local people, stakeholders and plot developers, to help create a place that is ‘Barking Made’, with pride and purpose for everyone.

factsheet.heading: View Luke Jerram’s Gaia at The Wilds at Barking Riverside
paragraphs: Gaia is the touring artwork created from 120dpi detailed NASA imagery of the Earth. The artwork gives you the opportunity to see our planet floating in three dimensions.

As well as viewing Gaia, you will also have the opportunity to explore Barking Riverside’s newest public building, The Wilds. Designed by Jestico + Whiles architects, The Wilds is a brand new multi-purpose community, ecology and events space.
Gaia is brought to The Wilds by Creative Barking and Dagenham and Barking Riverside Limited.

location.address: The Wilds at Barking Riverside, Northgate Road, Barking, IG11 0AN

name: Barking Riverside London
